Class SoundcheckView

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • org.midica.ui.player.soundcheck.SoundcheckView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class SoundcheckView
extends javax.swing.JDialog

    This class defines the UI for the soundcheck window.

    Author:
    Jan Trukenm√ºller

    • Constructor Detail

      • SoundcheckView

        private SoundcheckView(javax.swing.JDialog owner)

        Creates the soundcheck window.

        This constructor is private to ensure a singleton behaviour.

        Parameters:
        owner - The player window (a PlayerView object).

    • Method Detail

      • init

        private void init()

        Initializes the content of the soundcheck window. This is called by the constructor.

      • createVolOrVelSlider

        private MidicaSlider createVolOrVelSlider(SoundcheckController controller)

        Creates the volume or velocity slider for the soundcheck window.

        Parameters:
        controller - The event listener object for the soundcheck.
        Returns:
        the volume or velocity slider.

      • showSoundcheck

        public static void showSoundcheck(javax.swing.JDialog owner)

        This method is used instead of the (private) constructor to create the soundcheck window if not yet done.

        Parameters:
        owner - The player window (a PlayerView object).

      • close

        public static void close()

        Destroys the SoundcheckView object.

        This is called if the player window is closed.

      • makeVisible

        public void makeVisible()

        Shows the soundcheck window and brings it to the front.

        This is called whenever the soundcheck button in the player window is pushed.

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(byte volume)

        Sets the volume slider and the volume text field to the given value.

        Parameters:
        volume - The volume value to set.

      • setVelocity

        public void setVelocity(byte velocity)

        Sets the velocity slider and the velocity text field to the given value.

        Parameters:
        velocity - The velocity value to set.

      • setTextFieldColor

        public void setTextFieldColor(java.lang.String name,
                              java.awt.Color color)

        Sets the given text field’s background to the given color.

        Parameters:
        name - Text field name.
        color - Background color.

      • isVolumeSliderAdjusting

        public boolean isVolumeSliderAdjusting()

        Shows if the volume slider is being changed via mouse click in the moment.

        Returns true, if a mouse click on the slider has been started (mouse down) but is not yet finished (mouse up).

        Returns:
        true, if the slider is being changed. Otherwise: false.

      • isVelocitySliderAdjusting

        public boolean isVelocitySliderAdjusting()

        Shows if the velocity slider is being changed via mouse click in the moment.

        Returns true, if a mouse click on the slider has been started (mouse down) but is not yet finished (mouse up).

        Returns:
        true, if the slider is being changed. Otherwise: false.

      • getVolumeFromField

        public byte getVolumeFromField()
                        throws java.lang.NumberFormatException

        Returns the content of the volume text field.

        Returns:
        Volume from the text field.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the text cannot be parsed to a byte value.

      • getVeloctiyFromField

        public byte getVeloctiyFromField()
                          throws java.lang.NumberFormatException

        Returns the content of the velocity text field.

        Returns:
        Velocity from the text field.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the text cannot be parsed to a byte value.

      • getDurationFromField

        public int getDurationFromField()
                         throws java.lang.NumberFormatException

        Returns the content of the duration text field.

        Returns:
        Duration from the text field.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the text cannot be parsed to an integer value.

      • getChannel

        public int getChannel()

        Returns the currently selected channel from the channel combobox.

        Returns:
        the selected MIDI channel number.

      • isFilterLayerOpen

        public boolean isFilterLayerOpen()

        Indicates, if the string filter layer is currently open or not.

        Returns:
        true, if the layer is open, otherwise false;

      • getSelectedInstrumentRow

        public int getSelectedInstrumentRow()

        Determines the currently selected row index of the instrument table (model).

        Returns:
        selected row or -1 if no row is selected.

      • setSelectedInstrumentRow

        public void setSelectedInstrumentRow(int i)

        Selects the given row of the instruments table, if possible.

        Parameters:
        i - row index (model index) to be selected

      • getSelectedNoteIndex

        public int getSelectedNoteIndex()

        Determines the currently selected index of the note list.

        Returns:
        selected index or -1 if nothing is selected.

      • setSelectedNoteIndex

        public void setSelectedNoteIndex(int i)

        Selects the given index of the note list.

        Parameters:
        i - note index to be selected

      • scrollInstrumentTable

        public void scrollInstrumentTable()

        Scrolls the instrument table so that the selected row is visible.

      • scrollNoteList

        public void scrollNoteList(int i)

        Scrolls the note/percussion list so that the note with the given (selected) index is visible.

        Parameters:
        i - selected index to be made visible

      • getInstrument

        public int[] getInstrument()

        Returns the currently selected instrument coordinates from the instruments combobox.

        The returned value consists of the following parts:

        • program number
        • bank MSB
        • bank LSB

        If no instrument is selected, all these values are -1.

        Returns:
        program number, bank MSB and bank LSB of the selected instrument.

      • isDrumSelected

        public boolean isDrumSelected()

        Determins if the category or instrument currently selected in the instruments table is a drumkit or not.

        Returns:
        true, if a drumkit or drum category is selected. Otherwise: returns false

      • getNote

        public int getNote()

        Returns the currently selected note (or percussion instrument) from the note/percussion combobox.

        If no note or percussion instrument is selected, -1 is returned.

        Returns:
        the currently selected note or percussion number or -1 if nothing is selected.

      • toggleNoteListener

        public void toggleNoteListener(boolean on)

        Enables or disables the action listener for the note/percussion combobox, depending on the given value.

        The listener must be disabled temporarily while another channel is selected because that causes a rebuild of the note/percussion combobox.

        Parameters:
        on - true to activate the listener, false to deactivate it.

      • toggleInstrumentSelectionListener

        public void toggleInstrumentSelectionListener(boolean on)

        Enables or disables the selection listener for the instruments table. During channel selection the listener must be disabled temporarily while the instruments table is refilled and the last selection is restored.

        Parameters:
        on - true to activate the listener, false to deactivate it.

      • getVolume

        public byte getVolume()

        Returns the current volume from the volume slider.

        Returns:
        Volume value from the slider.

      • getVelocity

        public int getVelocity()

        Returns the current velocity from the velocity slider.

        Returns:
        Velocity value from the slider.

      • pressPlayButton

        public void pressPlayButton()

        Causes a click on the play button.

        This is called if an item from one of the comboboxes has been selected or if Enter has been pressed while one of the text fields was focused.

      • mustKeepSettings

        public boolean mustKeepSettings()

        Determins if the ‘keep settings’ checkbox is checked or not.

        Returns:
        true if the checkbox is checked. Otherwise: returns false.

      • addKeyBindings

        private void addKeyBindings()

        Adds key bindings to the soundcheck window using the KeyBindingManager.
